intro: Balsamita tridentata, commonly known as Mexican balsam or three-toothed balsam, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features opposite, ovate leaves with three distinct teeth, giving it its common name. Its small, tubular flowers are typically violet or blue, and they bloom in the summer months. Balsamita tridentata is often found in rocky soils and dry habitats, showing adaptability to arid environments.
